alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 8:12AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Barrow, DeKalb, Gwinnett and east central Fulton Counties through 900 AM EDT... At 812 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Sugar Hill to near Bolton, and moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Lawrenceville, Decatur, Winder, Peachtree Corners, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Dunwoody, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Snellville, Suwanee, Buford, Lilburn, Loganville, Chamblee, Norcross, Doraville and Clarkston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
